name: SFTP push | pull configuration request.txt - File transfers are an indispensable mode of information exchange when you are dealing with bulk data or there is an absence of tech to do the same via APIs. SFTP is a **S**ecure **F**ile **T**ransfer **P**rotocol that sends files over a secure shell (SSH) with proper data encryption between systems that exchange data. It also offers authentication methods —with a user ID and password, SSH key, or a combination of a password and SSH key. BEAM, which is razorpay's in-house intelligent (*debatable*) SFTP client program, allows us to create bi-directional file transfer jobs (*you either push or pull files*) with a simple 5 line configuration.
description: This section provides an overview of the SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol) process and its importance in sharing files, particularly for bulk data or when APIs are not available. It mentions that BEAM, an in-house SFTP client program, allows for bi-directional file transfer jobs with a simple 5-line configuration. The section also suggests reaching out to specific teams for reporting schedules, report contents, or custom needs that fall outside their jurisdiction.
use_cases: Reporting
Reconciliation
Settlements
Refunds
Sharing files in bulk
Exchanging data when APIs are not available
capabilities: Authentication methods (user ID and password, SSH key, or combination)
Bi-directional file transfer (push or pull files)

name:
SFTP push | pull configuration request.txt - :::info
BEAM currently supports only one file transfer protocol - SFTP.

Also remember,  FTPS and SFTP are not the same.

* FTPS is FTP over SSL
* SFTP is Secure FTP over SSH
:::
description: This section explains the difference between two secure file transfer protocols: FTPS (FTP over SSL) and SFTP (Secure FTP over SSH). It clarifies that BEAM, the system being discussed, currently supports only SFTP, which is a secure file transfer protocol that operates over an SSH (Secure Shell) connection. The section emphasizes that FTPS and SFTP are not the same, as FTPS is a different protocol that uses SSL/TLS encryption for FTP (File Transfer Protocol) connections.
use_cases: Secure file transfer between systems
Remote file management and transfer
Automated file transfer workflows
Integration with existing SSH infrastructure
capabilities: Differentiation between FTPS and SFTP protocols

name: SFTP push | pull configuration request.txt - **If the SFTP server is managed by the merchant/bank**
description: This section explains the necessary information and steps required to set up an SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol) connection for file transfers between Razorpay and a merchant/bank. It covers the scenario where the SFTP server is managed by the merchant/bank, as well as the case where the merchant/bank does not have an SFTP server, and Razorpay can provide access to their own AWS-managed SFTP server. The section outlines the specific details needed, such as IP addresses, port numbers, usernames, passwords or public keys, and the destination directory on the SFTP server.
